newsitem.title: USA: L.A. to review Duke-Louis Dreyfus utility alliance.
newsitem.headline: L.A. to review Duke-Louis Dreyfus utility alliance.

text.p: A special ad hoc committee convened by the Los Angeles City Council will vote June 9 to accept or reject plans by the Los Angeles Department of Water and Power (LADWP) to form an allinace with power marketer Duke-Louis Dreyfus, an LADWP spokeswoman said on Thursday.
The alliance is aimed at enhancing the utility's competitiveness as the electric power industry undergoes deregulation.
Duke-Dreyfus, a joint venture of North Carolina utility Duke Power Co and Louis Dreyfus Natural Gas Corp, was the winner of a year-long selection process.
The alliance was approved in February by the LADWP board of commissioners, but must still be voted on by the City Council.

The selection of Duke-Dreyfus has been protested by Edison International's Southern California Edison Co, which argued that the orginal bidding was unfair because it excluded Calfornia utilities from participating.
LADWP's service territory adjoins that of SoCal Edison.
In late February, Edison sweetened its bid to be the municipal utility's partner by adding participation of a national firm, NGC Corp and by guaranteeing LADWP $30 million over three years.
